core.templatetags package

Submodules

core.templatetags.my_filters module

Custom filters to be used within django templates Filters are functions used to change/format a value, usually for displaying purposes

core.templatetags.my_filters.add_spaces(value: str) → str

Replaces underscores with spaces and capitalizes every word

core.templatetags.my_filters.make_possessive(name: str) → str

Makes a name possessive by appropriately adding an apostrophe and s

core.templatetags.my_filters.to_int(value: str) → int

Converts strings to integers, even if the string is a float

core.templatetags.my_filters.to_str(value: Any) → str

Converts a value to a string

core.templatetags.my_tags module

Custom tags to be used in django templates Tags are functions that can be used within a template

core.templatetags.my_tags.any_query(checked: Dict[str, str]) → bool

Checks if any switch is checked

core.templatetags.my_tags.any_tab_selected(query: Dict[str, str]) → str

Checks wether the user is looking at a tab other than the main “Visited” tab on a UserProfile detail view

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_all_things() → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns a QuerySet object with all Thing objects

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_field_value(field: str, thing: core.models.thing.Thing) → str

Gets the value of a field of a Thing object independent of its category

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_good_fors(things: django.db.models.query.QuerySet) → List[str]

Returns all the good fors possible of Thing objects available

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_owner(pk: int) → core.models.user.UserProfile

Returns a UserProfile object with the given pk

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_param_value(param: str, query: Dict[str, str]) → str

Checks if a parameter is being filtered for and returns its value or an empty string

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_plans(user_pk: int) → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns all the plans a UserProfile object with the given pk has associated with it

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_sorts() → List[str]

Returns all sorts possible

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_thing(pk: int) → core.models.thing.Thing

Returns a Thing object with the given pk

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_things_near(thing: core.models.thing.Thing) → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns up to 5 Thing objects that match the given neighborhood

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_top_plans() → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns a QuerySet object of the top 5 plans by favorites

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_top_things() → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns a QuerySet object with the top 3 things by review count

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_types(things: django.db.models.query.QuerySet) → List[str]

Returns all types possible for Thing objects available

core.templatetags.my_tags.get_visible_plans(plans: django.db.models.query.QuerySet, user_viewing_pk: int, user_detail_pk: int) → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Returns the plans a user is allowed to view depending if they are the owner or if it is private

core.templatetags.my_tags.is_checked(select_filter: str, checked: Dict[str, str]) → Union[None, str]

Checks if a switch filter is checked

core.templatetags.my_tags.is_in_query(categories: str, query: Dict[str, str]) → bool

Checks if a the given categories are being filtered for

core.templatetags.my_tags.is_tab_selected(tab: str, query: Dict[str, str]) → str

Checks if a specific tab in a UserProfile detail view is active

core.templatetags.my_tags.things_sorted_by(sort_by: str, things: django.db.models.query.QuerySet) → django.db.models.query.QuerySet

Converts a sort option to the corresponding Thing field

core.templatetags.my_tags.user_favorited(user_pk: int, plan_pk: int) → bool

Checks wether a user has favorited a plan

core.templatetags.my_tags.user_reviewed(user_pk: int, thing_pk: int) → bool

Checks wether a user has reviewed on a thing
